Package com.healthcare.controller

Class PatientController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.healthcare.controller.PatientController
  • @RestController
public class PatientController
extends java.lang.Object
    Patient Controller is the Rest controller API for performing operations like Save patient , read patient , update and delete patient
    Author:
    Lovelesh

      • savePatient

        @PostMapping("/patient")
private int savePatient​(@RequestBody
                        com.healthcare.entity.Patient patient)
        Save Patient method is used accept new patient and save the data in Patient repository. Patients are created by sending HTTP POST requests to the API. The body of the request should contain a JSON object describing the patient to create
        Parameters:
        patient -
        Returns:
        PatiendId

      • getAllPatient

        @GetMapping("/patient")
private java.util.List<com.healthcare.entity.Patient> getAllPatient()
        PatientList is fetched by sending HTTP GET request to APi. Example User should send the request to /patient
        Returns:
        List - Retrieves all patient

      • getPatient

        @GetMapping("/patient/{id}")
private com.healthcare.entity.Patient getPatient​(@PathVariable("id")
                                                 int id)
        Single Patient is fetched by sending HTTP GET request by passing patient Id. Example - Http Get Request and url /patient/1
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        Patient

      • findPatientByName

        @GetMapping("/patient/name/{name}")
private java.util.List<com.healthcare.entity.Patient> findPatientByName​(@PathVariable("name")
                                                                        java.lang.String name)
        Patient List is fetched by sending HTTP Get request to API by passing name as parameter
        Parameters:
        name - - Name of the patient is provided
        Returns:
        List of patient entity is fetched
